00026 typedef struct {
00027         int i; // general index
00028         int m; // molecule index
00029         int r; // residue index
00030         int a; // atom index
00031 } molindex;
00032 typedef struct {
00033         int i; // general index
00034         int E; // ensemble
00035         int A; // assembly
00036         int m; // molecule index
00037         int r; // residue index
00038         int a; // atom index
00039 } ensindex;

00041 typedef struct { // for simple, all-one-residue bonding (for early programs)
00042         int s; // "source" -- index to first atom in bond
00043                 // this is redundant within an atom structure, but
00044                 // not if the bond structure is used independently
00045         int t; // "target" -- index to the other atom in the bond
00046         double o; // order of bond
00047         bond_type *typ; // pointer to type of bond
00048         int i; // index -- for example as alternative to *typ
00049         char *D; // free-form description
00050 } bond; // an actual bond (as opposed to an expected one)
00051 typedef struct {
00052         int n; // number of bonds
00053         bond *b; // n of these
00054 } bondset; // set of consecutive bonds
00055 typedef struct {
00056 // See the documentation directory for more information
00057         int ni; // number incoming bonds
00058         molindex *i; // atoms making incoming bonds
00059         int no; // number outgoing bonds
00060         molindex *o; // atoms making outgoing bonds
00061         molindex oref; // index of grandparent incoming atom to use to set torsion
00062         char RS, DL; // for R/S and D/L type chirality
00063         int pm; // for optical activity
00064         char *iso; // other description of isomerism
00065         double *angle; // angles (no + ni - 1)
00066         double *chirot; // chirality rotation (no + ni - 2)
00067         molindex itors; // index of grandparent incoming atom to use to set torsion
00068         double tors; // the torsion angle 
00069         double *distance; // distances (no)
00070 } connection_tree; // for detailed descriptions of 
00071 
00072 typedef struct {
00073         molindex s,t; // source & target atoms for bond
00074         double o; // order 
00075         bond_type *typ; // pointer to type of bond
00076         int i; // index -- for example as alternative to *typ
00077         char *D; // free-form description
00078 } molbond; // set of consecutive bonds
00079 
00080 typedef struct {
00081         int n;  // number of these
00082         molbond *b; // n of them
00083         char *D; // free-form description
00084 } molbondset; // set of consecutive bonds

00086 typedef struct {
00087         molindex a,b,c; // three atoms in the angle
00088         double ang; // the angle
00089         angle_type *typ; // pointer to type of angle
00090         char *D;// free-form descriptor
00091         int i; // index -- for example as alternative to *typ
00092 } angle_index; // index to atoms in an angle
00093 typedef struct {
00094         molindex a,b,c,d; // four atoms defining the torsion
00095         double ang; // the angle
00096         torsion_type *typ; // pointer to type of torsion
00097         char *D;// free-form descriptor
00098         int i; // index -- for example as alternative to *typ
00099 } torsion_index; // index to atoms in an angle

00101 /********** structure atom *************/
00102 typedef struct {
00103         int n; // atom number or other identifying index
00104         char *N; // atom name 
00105         char *T; // atom type name
00106         char *D; // free-form description
00107         int t; // type number -- must correspond to assignments of "atype" (see)
00108         atype *typ; // pointer to atype structure
00109         molindex moli; // the molecule index for this atom (address)
00110         int nb; // number of actual bonds (not expected bonds)
00111         bond *b; // bond structures (nb of these)
00112         int nmb; // number of bonds to other residues or molecules
00113         molbond *mb; // nmb of these
00114         coord_3D x; // atom's coordinates 
00115         int nalt; // number of alternate coordinate sets
00116         coord_3D *xa; // nalt of alternate coords
00117         int nvec; // number of vector sets
00118         vectormag_3D *v; // vector sets
00119         int nch; // number of charges
00120         double *ch; // nch charges for this atom
00121         int ni; // number of other indices
00122         int *i; // other indices, as needed (ni of these)
00123         int nd; // number of double-precision parameters
00124         double *d; // other parameters, as needed (nd of these) 
00125         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00126         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00127         char *sres; // name of some other/original residue to which this atom belonged
00128         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00129         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00130         int nVP; // number of void structures
00131         void *VP; // nVP of these, whatever they may be
00132 } atom; // an actual atom in a residue/molecule
00133 
00134 /********** structure residue *************/
00135 typedef struct {
00136         int n; // residue number given in input file
00137         char *N; // residue name 
00138         char *D; // free-form description for residue
00139         int t; // type number
00140         rtype *typ; // pointer to atype structure
00141         molindex moli; // the molecule index for this residue (address -- set .a to -1 or 0) 
00142         int na; // number of atoms in residue
00143         double m; // molecular weight
00144         coord_3D COM; // center of mass for residue
00145         atom *a; // atom structures (na of these)
00146         connection_tree *T; // na of these
00147         int nbs; // number of bond sets 
00148         bondset *bs; // (consecutive bonds, use these for plotting, etc.)
00149         int nr; // number of simple rings (no cage structures, etc.)
00150         int nrbs; // number of ring bondsets defined
00151         bondset *rbs; // bondsets for rings
00152         int nrc; // number of ring/reference coordinate sets defined
00153         coord_3D *rc; // coordinates for ring/reference centers
00154         int nrp; // number of ring planes defined
00155         plane *rp; // equations for average/approximate/exact/etc. ring planes (where useful)
00156         // need something for more complex structures eventually
00157         int ni; // number of other indices
00158         int *i; // other indices, as needed (ni of these)
00159         int nd; // number of double-precision parameters
00160         double *d; // other parameters, as needed (nd of these)
00161         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00162         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00163         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00164         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00165         int nVP; // number of void structures
00166         void *VP; // nVP of these, whatever they may be
00167 } residue; // an actual residue in a molecule
00168 
00169 /********** structure molecule *************/
00170 typedef struct {
00171         int i; // index
00172         char *N; // free-form name for molecule
00173         char *D; // free-form description for residue
00174         double m; // molecular weight
00175         int Ei; // number corresponding to parent ensemble
00176         int t; // type number
00177         mtype *typ; // pointer to atype structure
00178         coord_3D COM; // center of mass for molecule
00179         int na; // total number of atoms in molecule
00180         atom **a; // na of these, but should point into residues
00181         connection_tree *aT; // nat of these
00182         int nr; // number of residues
00183         residue *r; // pointers to residues
00184         connection_tree *rT; // nr of these
00185         int nrb; // number of bonds between residues
00186         molbond *rb; // nrb of these descriptions of bonds 
00187         int nrbs; // number of sets of bonds between residues (for example, linear chains)
00188         molbondset *rbs; // nrbs of these sets
00189         int nrc; // number of additional reference coordinates (rings, for example)
00190         coord_3D *rc; // nrc of these
00191         coord_3D boxl,boxh; // box dimensions
00192         int noi; // number of other indices
00193         int *oi; // other indices, as needed (ni of these)
00194         int nd; // number of double-precision parameters
00195         double *d; // other parameters, as needed (nd of these)
00196         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00197         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00198         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00199         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00200         int nVP; // number of void structures
00201         void *VP; // nVP of these, whatever they may be
00202 } molecule;

00204 /********** structure dockinfo *************/
00205 typedef struct{
00206         int i; // index
00207         int n; // number of docked structures represented
00208         coord_3D RC, *TR; // reference coordinate ; translation for docked structure
00209         vectormag_3D *Q, *QN, *QN0; // Quaternion x,y,z,w ; Quaternion nx,ny,nz,angle
00210         // NOTE!! do -not- use typical vectormag_3D functions on these structures
00211         int nTors; // Number of Torsions 
00212         double *Tors; // nTors torsions
00213         double *eFEB; // Estimated Free Energy of Binding, kcal/mol [=(1)+(3)]
00214         double *eKi, *Tmp; // Estimated Inhibition Constant, Ki & temperature, Kelvin
00215         double *fDE; // Final Docked Energy, kcal/mol [=(1)+(2)]
00216         double *fIE; // (1) Final Intermolecular Energy   
00217         double *fIEL; // (2) Final Internal Energy of Ligand 
00218         double *TFE; // (3) Torsional Free Energy          
00219         int nDIH; // number of dihedrals
00220         double *DIH; // the dihedrals
00221         molecule M; // to hold molecule info about the initial/docked structures
00222 } dockinfo;

00224 /********** structure assembly *************/
00225 typedef struct { // structure for groups of molecules within a larger structure
00226         int i; // index
00227         char *N; // name
00228         char *D; // description (free-form) (was *desc)
00229         double mass; // mass of assembly
00230         coord_3D COM; // center of mass 
00231         int nm; // number of molecule structures
00232         molecule **m; // nm of these
00233         connection_tree *mT; // nm of these
00234         //int nmb; // number of bonds/connections between molecules (H-bonds, for example)
00235         //molbond *mb; // nmb of these descriptions of connection 
00236         int nr; // number of residues
00237         residue **r; // nr of these -- probably best to point into molecules...
00238         connection_tree *rT; // nr of these
00239         int na; // number of atoms
00240         atom **a; // na of these -- probably best to point into mol/res combos
00241         connection_tree *aT; // nat of these
00242         int nb; // total number of bonds
00243         molbond *b; // the bonds
00244         int nANG; // # of angles
00245         angle_index *ANG; // nANG of these
00246         int nTOR; // # of torsions
00247         torsion_index *TOR; // nTOR of these
00248         int nPRM; // number of parameter sets
00249         parameter_set *PRM; // pointer to parameter sets
00250         int nmbs; // number of sets of connections between molecules 
00251         molbondset *mbs; // nmbs of these sets
00252         coord_3D boxl,boxh; // box dimensions (limits low & high or just use one for size)
00253         double boxang; // coord_3D is x, y and z -- angle (probably between XY and YZ planes in degrees, maybe).  
00254         char *boxtype; // type of box
00255         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00256         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00257         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00258         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00259         int nVP; // number of void pointers
00260         void *VP; // void pointers
00261 } assembly;

00263 /********** structure ensemble *************/
00264 typedef struct { // structure for an entire system of molecules

00266         char *N; // name
00267         char *D; // free-form descriptor
00268         double mass; // mass of ensemble
00269         coord_3D COM; // center of mass 
00270         int nm; // number of molecule structures
00271         molecule *m; // nm of these
00272         int na; // number of assembly structures
00273         assembly *a; // na of these
00274         coord_3D boxl,boxh; // box dimensions
00275         int nPRM; // number of parameter sets
00276         parameter_set *PRM; // pointer to parameter sets
00277         int nOD; // number of other descriptors
00278         char **OD; // the nOD descriptors
00279         int nensi; // number of ensemble indices
00280         ensindex *ensi; // list of ensemble indices
00281         int nVP; // number of void pointers
00282         void *VP; // void pointers
00283 } ensemble;

00285 /* The following is a set of functions intended primarily to facilitate 
00286 debugging.  But, they could easily be used for verbose data output within
00287 the program.  They all follow the same basic format:
00288 
00289 print_X(X *x, int level)
00290 
00291 where   X = one of the structures defined above (e.g., molecule, residue, 
00292                 bondset, atom, bond, atype, plane, vectormag_3D, coord_3D).
00293         *x = pointer to your structure
00294         level = the depth to print.  This is only available on structures 
00295                 likely to contain arrays of other structures.  level=0 only
00296                 prints the top-level information.  level=1 prints one level 
00297                 down of other structures, lists, etc. level=2 prints two 
00298                 levels down, etc.   The value of level can be larger than 
00299                 the depth available -- the function will stop when it runs
00300                 out of structures to print.  
00301 */
00302 int NUMAT;

00305 void print_atype(atype*,int),print_plane(plane*);
00306 void print_vectormag_3D(vectormag_3D*),print_coord_3D(coord_3D*);

00318 /* the following are geometric operations for the structures defined above 
00319         where int is xl ("x" (coordinate) location):
00320                 xl refers to position in the atom structure
00321                         xl=-1 means use the atom.x structure
00322                         xl=0,1,2,etc means use the atom.xa[xl] or
00323                                 the atom.v[xl] structure
00324         where int,int is "xl,vl" it refers to coord and vector location
00325                 (in that order).
00326         where int is n
00327                 n indicates the number of blocks in the preceding pointer
00328 
00329    All of the following that involve vectors will set the magnitude of 
00330         the resulting vector without relying on the entry in the input 
00331         vector.  So, for example, there is no need to get_magnitude 
00332         before normalizing or multiplying by a scalar.
00333 */
00334 /* this moves all the coords in molecule so that the center of mass
00335 for the molecule is at the origin (right now, though, it only works
00336 if the molecule has only one residue...*/
00337 void translate_to_COM(molecule *,atype *,int); // int is xl
00338         // this assumes the initial coords are in atom.x
00339 //void translate_zero_to_COM(molecule *,atype *,int,int); 
00340         // int#1 is xs, the location of the source coords
00341         // int#2 is xt, the location of the translated coords
00342 void translate_zero_to_coord_M(molecule *,int,int,coord_3D); 
00343         // int#1 is xs, the location of the source coords
00344         // int#2 is xt, the location of the translated coords
00345 void assign_residue_COM(residue *r,atype *ATYPE);
00346 void assign_molecule_COM(molecule *m,atype *ATYPE);
00347 void assign_assembly_COM(assembly *a,atype *ATYPE);
00348 void assign_ensemble_COM(ensemble *e,atype *ATYPE);
00349 coord_3D get_residue_COM(residue *r,atype *ATYPE,int xs);
00350 coord_3D get_molecule_COM(molecule *m,atype *ATYPE,int xs);
00351 coord_3D get_assembly_COM(assembly *a,atype *ATYPE,int xs);
00352 coord_3D get_ensemble_COM(ensemble *e,atype *ATYPE,int xs);

00354 /* the following functions rotate the coordinate list such that the
00355 vector given by vectormag_3D points along the Z (Y, X, other) axis.
00356 The orientation of the orthogonal axes is arbitrary. */
00357 void rotate_vector_to_Z_M(molecule*,int,int,int,int,vectormag_3D); 
00358         // The four integers are:
00359         // int#1 location of source coordinates (-1=x, 0,1,2,etc=xa[xs]
00360         // int#2 location of rotated coordinates (-1=x, 0,1,2,etc=xa[xs]
00361         // int#3 location of source vectors (-1=do not calc, 0,1,2,etc=v[xs]
00362         // int#4 location of rotated vectors (-1=do not calc, 0,1,2,etc=v[xs]
00363 void rotate_vector_to_Z_list(coord_3D*,int,vectormag_3D); // int is n
